posts.name: AllScale
posts.text: Stables weekly recap thread: Fidelity FIDD launch/redemption design, Tether investment update, and Polymarket moving from USDC.e to native USDC.
posts.fullText:
Stables weekly recap thread:

1) Fidelity's FIDD launch/redemption design is now clearer, with tighter primary-market mechanics than earlier drafts.
2) Tether published a fresh investment update, including treasury allocation and risk controls.
3) Polymarket is migrating from USDC.e to native USDC for cleaner settlement and lower bridge-dependency.

Net: market structure is maturing through better redemption rails, deeper transparency, and standardization on native liquidity.

posts.name: TrendSpider
posts.text: Capitulation found. $HOOD
posts.fullText:
Capitulation found on $HOOD.

Price action shows accelerated downside exhaustion with sentiment stretched to pessimistic extremes. Historically this setup can precede sharp mean-reversion bounces when volume confirms.

Not financial advice; manage risk and wait for confirmation.

posts.name: Range
posts.text: USDC over Circle CCTP is becoming a default cross-chain settlement layer; Range launched explorer/intel API for transfer visibility.
posts.fullText:
USDC over Circle CCTP is becoming a default cross-chain settlement layer.

We're seeing faster routing decisions from teams that prioritize canonical USDC over wrapped liquidity. To support this, Range launched explorer + intel APIs so desks can monitor transfer paths, latency, and destination concentration in real time.

When visibility improves, treasury operations become less reactive and more systematic.

posts.name: WOLF
posts.text: Did you know that Super Micro $SMCI brought in more revenue than $AMD this past quarter https://t.co/eMKbeFr5FK

comments.name: Ayush Jasoria | MBA & Engineer | Investor & Trader

posts.fullText: Did you know that Super Micro $SMCI brought in more revenue than $AMD this past quarter https://t.co/eMKbeFr5FK

posts.name: Leverage Shares ETFs
posts.text:
Supermicro vs AMD: The AI Revenue Shift

$SMCI beat and raised guidance, targeting $40B FY2026 revenue as AI server demand accelerates.

$AMD also beat, but flagged a more measured AI ramp.

AI spend is real, but revenue is crystallizing first at the infrastructure layer.

posts.name: Stock Market Nerd
posts.text: Detailed $HOOD & $SHOP earnings reviews: key points, demand, profits, balance sheet, guide & valuation, plus management call takeaways.
posts.fullText:
Detailed $HOOD earnings review thread:

- Revenue mix improved with options + interest income staying resilient.
- Cost discipline helped margins surprise to the upside.
- Balance sheet remains flexible for product expansion.
- Guidance implies management sees durable engagement, not just event-driven spikes.

Call takeaways: product velocity and distribution remain the core edge; watch retention quality and incremental monetization per active user.

posts.name: Tesla
posts.text: Tesla showcased an FSD Supervised case detecting an in-lane broken-down vehicle and changing lanes to avoid collision.
posts.fullText: FSD Supervised has 360-degree awareness and can react faster than a human, detecting a broken-down vehicle in lane and moving over.
